intro: Crepis bumbensis, commonly known as the Bumbi hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by bracts that resemble hawk's teeth, giving it its common name. Crepis bumbensis is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
